to speed up decision-making at the Internet giant. In a regulatory filing last week, Google Inc. said that Eric Schmidt in December drew up a plan to sell some of his stock in the company. The pre-arranged trading plan was adopted in order to allow Eric Schmidt to sell a portion of his Google Inc. stock as part of his long-term strategy for individual asset diversification and liquidity, the filing said. As of Dec. 31, Eric Schmidt had about 9.2 million shares of Google Inc. stock and controlled 9.6% of the company's voting power. Eric Schmidt plans to sell about 534,000 shares of Class
